contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, it would be nice if the weather in May were always like this. It's warm again highs close to the seasonal norms.

Right, Conn-young. We can expect warmer spells for tomorrow with the high in Seoul reaching up to 24 degrees. It's finally getting close to the norm of 23.4 degrees. But there will be wider temperature gaps of nearly 10 degrees between the highs and lows, so please make sure to dress in layers.

Tomorrow night, rain is in the forecast in the Seoul metropolitan area and Gangwon-do Province and there could be intervals of thunderstorms, so please be aware. On Sunday, rain is back again in the western regions and the Jeolla provinces.

For tomorrow morning, Seoul will start off warm at 15 degrees, Daegu at 12 and Busan 13 degrees.

Daytime highs will be warmer than today's with Seoul at 24 degrees, Daegu at 24 and Busan at 20 degrees.

For the time being, the inflow of dust from overseas is very low. Air quality across South Korea is expected to stay at ‘good’ levels until the beginning of next week.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Warm and cloudy spells nationwide but be aware of wide temperature gaps
Updated: 2020-05-21 17:18:55 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. It will be a pleasant day with blue skies and a lot of sunshine. In fact, those of us in the west as well as Daegu, Busan and Ulsan will have very high UV levels during the day. Don't forget your sun protective items. We'll also have good air quality nationwide.

Temperature-wise, highs will be 1 to 3 degrees higher today but like yesterday the east coast will be breezy again due to easterly winds, Busan and Gangneung getting up to just 19 and 18 degrees.

For other regions, Gwangju will get up to 25 degrees, Daejeon 24 while Daegu and Jeju will hit 23 degrees this afternoon.

Let's enjoy the comfortable temperatures while they are here, starting next week, we'll notice much higher readings and this summer is forecast to be a hot one. Shorter-term, wet weather is in store for Friday evening and Sunday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Fine day under plenty of sunshine
Updated: 2020-05-21 07:04:28 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. As long as you are aware of the big temperature gaps between lows and highs, it's shaping up to be a fine day. Temperatures will be a couple notches higher than yesterday. It's a bright and chilly start, but afternoon highs will hike fast to hover near the seasonal norms so dress accordingly on your way out.

Taking a closer look, lows are slightly higher than the same time yesterday.. Seoul at about 11 degrees Celsius, Chuncheon at just 8 degrees. Inland regions are covered with thick fog so drive with care.

Highs will be 2 to 3 degrees higher today with decent air nationwide but the east coast will be relatively breezy again due to easterly winds, Busan getting up to 19 degrees.

Enjoy a rain free day today, but wet weather in store for Friday evening. Sunday is also shaping up to be a rainy day as well.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Big temperature gaps under bright skies
Updated: 2020-05-21 06:04:47 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, today marks 'Soman' on the Korean peninsula, which means that summer has started in earnest calendar-wise. But we had cloudy spells all day in the capital.

Right, Conn-young. According to the East Asian calendar, today is 'Soman', the start of the second part of summer. Although sunny skies have recovered just in time, it's still relatively chilly with temperatures around 4 to 5 degrees lower than what we would normally see at this time of year. Also, the seasonal clock seems to be going backwards in Gangwon-do Province as there was 2cm of snow observed on Seoraksan Mountain yesterday.

It will get warmer starting tomorrow, and temperatures will continue to rise in the capital until Friday with highs of 25 degrees Celsius. But cloudy spells are forecasted until Friday. And for Gangwon-do Province in particular, further bouts of rain are in store on Friday and Sunday.

For tomorrow morning, Seoul will start off at 11 degrees, Gwangju and Daegu at 12 degrees.

Daytime highs will be 2 to 4 degrees higher with Seoul at 23 degrees, Gwangju and Daegu at 24 degrees.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will once again have rainy spells, while Beijing may experience some intervals of thunderstorms.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Relatively chilly spells…good air quality nationwide
Updated: 2020-05-20 17:27:57 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. Today's temperatures will be 2 to 7 degrees higher for most parts. Those of you in southern regions will notice a big rise in readings. The East coast will have cooler day time highs due to easterly winds.

Highs will below the seasonal norms in most parts ranging from 17 to 22 degrees Celsius. The weather will be more stable under a fair amount of sunshine

The further south you are, the more sunshine you will see today with stronger UV levels, while eastern parts of Gangwon-do Province will have 5 to 10 millimeters of rain into the evening.

Readings will hike to near the seasonal norms starting tomorrow but big gaps between lows and highs will continue.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Stable weather but cooler temperatures than norms
Updated: 2020-05-20 06:08:15 KST

contents.context:
Time now to get a check on the weather, let's go over to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center.
Seung-min, the rain has stopped in most parts of the country.
So, are we all in the clear?

Well, Conn-young. The rain has stopped in most places now, including here in Seoul. But there are still some light showers going on in some areas. Especially in Gangwon-do province, we can still expect quite amount of rain of 10 to 40mm. And in other regions, little rain of 5 mm are in forecast. Strong wind advisory is in forecast around the coastal areas and Jeju so please be aware.

The temperature will gradually rise and the spring weather will recover in the latter part of the week. In the area around Seoul and in Gangwon-do province where cloudy spells will remain throughout, more rain is expected on Friday and Sunday.

For tomorrow morning, we'll see mostly sunny spells throughout the country with Seoul, Gwangju and Daegu at 11 degrees Celsius.

Daytime highs will be 1 to 4 degrees higher with Seoul at 19, Gwangju and Daegu at 21.

For Korea's neighbors, Tokyo will see periodic showers throughout the day with highs of 19 degrees.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Rain eases in most regions... in Gangwon-do heavy rain in forecast until Thursday
Updated: 2020-05-19 17:09:02 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. It will continue to be wet with on and off heavy showers and occasional thunderstorms. Mountainous regions and other areas in Gangwon-do Province could receive 150 millimeters more rain with a rain warning in place. There could be flooding as well so be careful if you are in that part of the country.

Temperatures will be cool, highs will be nearly 10 degrees Celsius lower than yesterday in Seoul. It will only get up to 16 degrees this afternoon.

For other regions, Busan will reach 20 degrees. Daegu and Jeju will get up to 21 degrees and Jeju will be dry. Gangwon-do will see rain into Thursday while the rest of us will see showers letting up by tonight.

Readings will remain lower than the seasonal norms for the next few days, and we are forecast to see more rain on Friday and Saturday.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.context:
